definitions: knot that forms a noose which tightens when pulled
American heavy metal band formed in 1995
examples: He tied a slipknot to secure the rope around the post
The climber used a slipknot for the safety line
Slipknot performed their hit songs at the festival
Many fans wore Slipknot masks to the concert

definitions: act or instance of slipping or sliding from position
failure to meet targets or maintain expected standards over time
examples: The engineer detected slippage in the transmission system
Ground slippage caused the foundation to crack
Project slippage resulted in missed deadlines
There was significant slippage in quarterly sales figures

definitions: soft comfortable shoe worn indoors, typically without fastening
examples: She put on her fuzzy slippers before getting out of bed
His leather slippers were worn from years of use

definitions: long narrow cut or opening in something
examples: Light filtered through the slit in the curtains
The dress had a slit up the side
The slit allowed coins to pass through

definitions: small thin sharp piece of something broken off
examples: A sliver of glass embedded itself in her finger
He cut the cheese into thin slivers

definitions: short memorable phrase used in advertising or politics
examples: The company's slogan appeared on every billboard
Their campaign slogan resonated with young voters

definitions: dirty water or liquid waste
unappetizing watery food or drink
examples: He emptied the slop bucket behind the barn
Kitchen slop was collected for the pigs
The cafeteria served something that looked like slop
Prison slop was barely edible

definitions: surface that inclines upward or downward from horizontal
degree of inclination of a line in mathematics
examples: The ski slope was perfect for beginners
They built their house on a gentle slope
Calculate the slope of the line between these two points
The slope indicates the rate of change

definitions: narrow opening into which something fits
allocated time period in a schedule
position or role in an organization
examples: Insert the coin into the slot
The key fits perfectly in the slot
Your appointment slot is at three o'clock
The TV show has a prime time slot
She earned a slot on the team
There's one slot remaining in the program

definitions: slow-moving tropical American mammal that hangs from trees
reluctance to work or make effort; extreme laziness
examples: The sloth hung motionless from the branch
Sloths move incredibly slowly through the rainforest
His sloth prevented him from achieving his goals
Spiritual sloth is considered one of the seven deadly sins

definitions: reduction in speed, activity, or rate of production
examples: The economic slowdown affected employment rates
Traffic slowdown caused major delays during rush hour

definitions: process of becoming slower or less active
examples: The slowing of her heartbeat worried the doctors
Economic slowing prompted government intervention

definitions: thick soft wet mud or similar viscous mixture
thick viscous residue from industrial or sewage treatment
examples: The river bottom was covered with thick sludge
Black sludge clogged the drain
Toxic sludge from the factory polluted the waterway
Sewage sludge requires proper treatment before disposal

definitions: shell-less terrestrial gastropod mollusk
bullet or projectile for a gun
hard blow with the fist
examples: Garden slugs destroyed her lettuce plants
The slug left a slimy trail across the path
The shotgun was loaded with slugs
Police found slug casings at the scene
He took a slug to the jaw
The boxer delivered a powerful slug

definitions: baseball player known for hitting home runs powerfully
examples: The slugger hit three home runs in the game
Every team needs a reliable slugger in the lineup

definitions: densely populated urban area characterized by poverty and substandard housing
examples: The government promised to improve conditions in the slums
Many families struggle to escape the slum

definitions: peaceful sleep, especially of a deep or prolonged nature
examples: The baby fell into peaceful slumber
Nothing could disturb his deep slumber

definitions: sudden severe or prolonged fall in price, value, or amount
heavy drooping posture or position
examples: The stock market experienced a major slump
Sales went into a slump after the holiday season
He sat in a slump at his desk
Her shoulders were in a tired slump

definitions: insinuation or allegation intended to damage reputation
indistinct pronunciation of words
examples: The racial slur resulted in immediate suspension
She sued the newspaper for publishing slurs about her
His speech had a noticeable slur after the stroke
Alcohol caused him to slur his words

definitions: partially melted snow or ice
fund for illicit or corrupt payments
examples: Cars struggled through the slush on the roads
Gray slush accumulated along the sidewalks
The investigation uncovered a political slush fund
Corporate slush funds were used for bribes

definitions: offensive term for a woman perceived as promiscuous
examples: Using such slurs reflects poorly on the speaker
The word has been reclaimed by some feminist movements

definitions: sharp slap or blow with the palm
loud kiss
slight taste or trace of something
examples: The smack echoed through the room
She gave him a smack on the cheek
He gave her a loud smack on the lips
The baby gave grandma a wet smack
There was a smack of garlic in the sauce
His story had a smack of truth to it

definitions: of limited size, amount, or extent
examples: The small kitten fit in her palm
They lived in a small apartment downtown

definitions: highly contagious viral disease marked by fever and distinctive skin rash
examples: Smallpox was eradicated through global vaccination efforts
Historical smallpox epidemics killed millions of people

definitions: mobile phone with advanced computing capabilities and internet access
examples: She checked her email on her smartphone
Modern smartphones have replaced many other devices

definitions: violent breaking or shattering of something
outstanding popular or commercial success
examples: The smash of glass alerted the neighbors
The car smash left debris everywhere
The movie was a box office smash
Her new song became an instant smash hit

definitions: act of breaking something violently
extremely good or wonderful
examples: The smashing of windows continued throughout the riot
Plate smashing is part of some Greek celebrations
The party was absolutely smashing
She looked smashing in her new dress

definitions: slight superficial knowledge or small amount of something
examples: She had a smattering of French from school
The audience offered only a smattering of applause

definitions: mark or streak of greasy or sticky substance
false accusation intended to damage reputation
examples: There was a smear of lipstick on the glass
Paint smears covered his work clothes
The political smear campaign backfired
Media smears damaged her reputation

definitions: quality that can be perceived by the olfactory sense
faculty or power of perceiving odors
examples: The smell of fresh bread filled the bakery
A strange smell came from the basement
Dogs have an exceptional sense of smell
She lost her smell after the accident

definitions: act or process of perceiving odors
examples: The smelling of flowers brought back memories
Wine smelling is part of proper tasting

definitions: pleased, kind, or amused facial expression with upturned mouth corners
examples: Her warm smile brightened the room
The baby's first smile delighted her parents

definitions: simple drawing or emoticon of a smiling face
examples: She added a smiley to the end of her text
The yellow smiley face became an iconic symbol

definitions: act or state of forming a smile
examples: Her constant smiling made everyone feel welcome
Smiling releases endorphins in the brain

definitions: person who works with metal, especially a blacksmith
examples: The village smith repaired farm equipment
Medieval smiths were essential craftsmen

definitions: workshop of a smith, especially a blacksmith
examples: The old smithy still had its original forge
Smoke billowed from the village smithy

definitions: loose dress or protective garment worn over clothes
examples: The artist wore a paint-stained smock
Children wore smocks to protect their uniforms

definitions: fog intensified by smoke or chemical fumes
examples: Dense smog blanketed the city for days
Smog alerts warned people to stay indoors

definitions: visible vapor from burning material
act or period of smoking tobacco
examples: Black smoke poured from the burning building
Smoke from the campfire stung their eyes
He stepped outside for a quick smoke
Her morning smoke accompanied her coffee

definitions: building where meat or fish is cured with smoke
examples: The smokehouse produced delicious smoked salmon
Traditional smokehouses preserve meat without refrigeration

definitions: person who smokes tobacco regularly
device or apparatus for smoking food
examples: Former smokers often struggle with cravings
The restaurant has a section for smokers
The barbecue smoker produced perfectly tender ribs
He bought a new smoker for the backyard

definitions: something designed to disguise, conceal, or deceive
examples: The scandal was just a smokescreen for larger corruption
His anger created a smokescreen for his insecurity

definitions: tall chimney, especially of a factory or ship
examples: The factory's smokestack dominated the skyline
Black smoke billowed from the ship's smokestack

definitions: act or habit of using tobacco products
examples: Smoking is prohibited in all public buildings
His smoking habit affected his health significantly

definitions: thick beverage of pureed fruit blended with milk, yogurt, or ice
examples: She made a strawberry banana smoothie for breakfast
The gym sells protein smoothies after workouts

definitions: dirty mark or smear
examples: There was a smudge of ink on the document
Fingerprint smudges covered the glass door

definitions: person who imports or exports goods illegally
examples: Drug smugglers were arrested at the border
Historical smugglers avoided paying customs duties

definitions: illegal movement of goods or people across borders
examples: Arms smuggling threatens regional security
Diamond smuggling funds criminal organizations

definitions: obscene or lascivious talk, writing, or pictures
fungal disease of cereal crops
examples: The bookstore refused to sell what they considered smut
Internet filters block access to smut
Corn smut destroyed much of the harvest
Farmers treat seeds to prevent smut

definitions: small amount of food eaten between regular meals
examples: She packed healthy snacks for the road trip
The vending machine offers various snacks
